name: From A Lost Tunnel
description:
"The place has been cursed. A creature which is neither alive nor dead has taken residence here."

The game is a small dungeon crawler made for the Dungeon Crawler Jam 2021.

All the game mechanics existed before the jam. My goal during the jam week was to make a game creating all content from scratch using only my new game editor, without additionnal coded content, to see what can come from it. I also wanted to try to use illustrations from old books as assets.

The game is short and unambitious due to the time limitation, I hope the dungeon mechanics makes for a pleasant experience anyway. It should take about one hour to complete.

Credits to :
- Music by Louise Byrne : https://louisebyrnemusic.com/
- Wall textures and grass by Nevrax SARL / Winch Gate Properties Ltd. Ryzom. : https://atys.wiki.ryzom.com/wiki/Ryzom_Commons:About
- Trees by Onsemeliot : https://opengameart.org/users/onsemeliot
- Daylight sky by bart : https://opengameart.org/content/sky-backdrop
- Night sky by GameSupplyGuy : https://gamesupply.itch.io/

Other illustrations taken from :
- Dictionnaire Infernal by Collin de Plancy, Jacques-Albin-Simon, Louis Le Breton
- Death's doings by Richard Dagley
- Les Châteaux suisses by Élisabeth de Montolieu, H. Van Muyden 
- The Marvellous Adventures of Sir John Maundevile by John Cameron Grant, Sir John Mandeville, Arthur Layard
- Le Chemin des Écoliers; Promenade de Paris à Marly-le-Roy, en suivant les bords du Rhin by Joseph Xavier Boniface
- The Oxford Thackeray by William Makepeace Thackeray, George Saintsbury
- Don Quixote by Gustave Doré
- Az Osztrák by Rudolf, Crown Prince of Austria, Mór Jókai
- Illustrated British Ballads, old and new by George Barnett Smith
- Das alte Wunderland der Pyramiden. Geographische, geschichtliche, kultur-historische Bilder by Carl Oppel
- Brehms Tierleben : allgemeine Kunde des Tierreichs by Alfred Edmund Brehm, Eduard Pechuel-Loesche, Wilhelm Haacke, E. H. Schroeder
